title: Iran Strikes Spark Oil Price Surge
summary: Following recent U.S. airstrikes in Iran, oil prices surged amid fears that the Strait of Hormuz could be blocked, disrupting global supply.
timeline: June 21, 2025 — U.S. airstrikes hit military targets in Iran
June 22, 2025 — Iran threatens to close the Strait of Hormuz
June 22, 2025 — Brent Crude rises 6% in early trading
why_matters: The Strait of Hormuz handles nearly 20% of global oil traffic. Any disruption could lead to economic shocks, inflation, and military escalation.
